original_title: Sri Lanka to spend Rs206bn on revised welfare benefit program
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka plans to spend 206 billion rupees a year on welfare benefits under a revised process where a social safety net is made to help sections of society who are truly in need of assistance, Cabinet spokesman Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.
There are concerns that under the current welfare system, some who are truly in need are not getting support due to the lack of an effective mechanism to enter and exist welfare systems.
Following recommendations made by a technical committee, benefits will be paid in a poverty gap to individual who are poor, who are extreme poverty and those are risk.
Separate benefits will be paid to disabled, kidney patients and the aged.
The new scheme will be in operation from July 01, 2023. (Colombo/Apr18/2023)
